thread.title: Bangladesh see off Nepal to storm into Rollball World Cup semifinals
thread.title_full: Bangladesh see off Nepal to storm into Rollball World Cup semifinals

title: Bangladesh see off Nepal to storm into Rollball World Cup semifinals
text:
Bangladesh see off Nepal to storm into Rollball World Cup semifinals Sports Correspondent bdnews24.com Previous Next Bangladesh have cruised into the semifinals of the Rollball World Cup with an easy win over Nepal. 
The hosts beat Nepal 6-3 after netting four times in a commanding first-half display in the quarter-finals of the fourth edition of the tournament at Mirpur Indoor Stadium on Tuesday. 
Hridoy hit the target thrice, Shohag twice and Arafat scored the other to secure Bangladesh's best showing in the competition, eclipsing the previous best of seventh position. Bangladesh began the tournament with a 19-1 demolition of Hong Kong in their opener before sweeping past Bhutan 9-2 in the next. An 11-0 rout of Myanmar and victory against Fiji secured their place in the last 16 as Pool D champions.
Bangladesh stormed into the quarterfinals by demolishing Chinese Taipei 12-1.
